com.payu.india.Payu

Class PayuUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.payu.india.Payu.PayuUtils
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MerchantWebServicePostParams, PaymentDefaultPostParams, PayUChecksumParams

    public class PayuUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by franklin on 6/18/15. Payu util class provides protected, public functions to sdk and App. Use the SBI_MAES_BIN set to find whether the number is state bank maestro number or not Use the validateCardNumber(String) method to validate user card number, it includes length luhn validation. Use the luhn(String) method to validate card number, use this function only if you validate length at your end. Use the getIssuer(String) method to get the issuer, it will return the issuer from {VISA, AMEX, MAES, MAST, SMAE, LASER, DINR, JCB} use the validateCvv(String, String) method to validate cvv, AMEX has 4 digit, SMAE has no cvv, other has 3 dight cvv. use the validateExpiry(int, int) method to validate whether the card is expired or not!. use the concatParams(String, String) method to concat both params1 and param2 using equal to (=) and add a ampersand at the end! adding default argumentsgetReturnData(String) getReturnData(int, String) use the getReturnData(int, String, String) to send the data back to app as PostData use the trimAmpersand(String) remove leading ampersand if any!.

      static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> SBI_MAES_BIN
      Known Sate bank maestro bins helps us to validate cvv expmon, expyr, SMAE cards do not have CVV, Expiry month, Expiry year.

      • getIssuer

        public java.lang.String getIssuer(java.lang.String mCardNumber)
        Gives the Issuer of the card number. using simple regex we can actually figure out the card belong to which issuer amoung VISA, AMEX, MAES, MAST, SMAE, LASER, DINR, JCB
        Parameters:
        mCardNumber - first 6 digit of card number is more than enough to figure out. (Card Bin)
        Returns:
        Issuer of the card

      • validateCvv

        public boolean validateCvv(java.lang.String cardNumber,
                           java.lang.String cvv)
        helps to validate cvv we need card bin to figure out issuer, from issuer we validate cvv Oh! AMEX has 4 digit, Crap! SMAE has no cvv, okay, other has 3 dight cvv.
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - Card bin
        cvv - cvv
        Returns:
        true if valid cvv else false
